TopicTitle: Was there an update that swapped 64-bit back to non-default?

Articles.Content:
Or did I mess up my game?  I deleted all the mods I installed manually, then installed CKAN to have that manage my mods, went to load up game and now it asks on launch if I want to run default or 64bit exe.  I haven't played in 36 hours but last time I did, 64-bit exe was default and the 32-bit exe was the alternate,

 

<<edit>> Steam version.  I need to know if I have to reinstall my game  - would someone just load up KSP and see if it's same for you?

Edited April 23, 2016 by jpinard

Didnt know 32 bit was stillan option... I use it from steam and its 64 bit default for me. My only issue is a gigantic nav ball...cant reduce its size with out shrinking the entire ui to painfully small text sizes. Swear prior versions had a toggle for the nav ball. Asked this over in gameplay but no ones andwered it
Hmmm, I noticed the same thing. Does it crash if you play the 32bit version by accident? Mine crashed 4 times before I noticed the change.
I just made a short cut of the 64 bit exe from my steam install (I did NOT use Steam's make a short cut feature) and used that because steam can act funny sometimes when launching or updating games.

3 hours ago, sardia said:

Hmmm, I noticed the same thing. Does it crash if you play the 32bit version by accident? Mine crashed 4 times before I noticed the change.

Why would they change that?  *confused*
Same here.  It was defaulting to 64bit.  Now it defaults to 32.

yup, for whatever obscure reason someone decided to revert to having 32 bit as the default. IMO there shouldn't even be a 32 bit, anyone with a computer from the last decade or so should have a 64 bit operating system and anyone who has an older computer won't be able to run KSP at acceptable performance anyway.
I too think there was a silent update, it seems to have stopped parts of the Editor extensions mod from working.
Build number is still 1230. But indeed (at least the Steam version) it now reverts back to 32 bit as default option.

Silent update? Please!? Is this to be expected around here??

Many players copy their KSP out of the steam folders etc, would be nice if there was some transparency on updates.

How many digits has that built number again?  And if its still not enough just add another digit, but no silent updates please, thats unacceptable in my opinion

Pre-release beta starts in 32 bit by default, latest version 1.1.0.1228

Release version is 1.1.0.1230 and is supposed to start 64 bit by default ... what the ... looks like it does start the 32 bit version for me as well. But I don't think that Squad has anything to do with it.

Oh, and I had Steam check the integrity of the game cache: it reacquired 2 files but nothing has changed, still 32 instead of 64. At least the option to start KSPx64 is available so I don't have to mess around with the files.

I'll check my Steam logs and see if I find anything.

Edited April 23, 2016 by SunburstMoon

1 hour ago, jwenting said:

yup, for whatever obscure reason someone decided to revert to having 32 bit as the default. IMO there shouldn't even be a 32 bit, anyone with a computer from the last decade or so should have a 64 bit operating system and anyone who has an older computer won't be able to run KSP at acceptable performance anyway.

I still find it strange that Unity was ever 32bit.  What year is it, anyway?
Probably stop assuming Squad has anything to do with Steam maybe.

6 minutes ago, stibbons said:

Probably stop assuming Squad has anything to do with Steam maybe.

How about we stop using Unity and Steam as excuses for Squad?  Consumers should not be expected to care about how the sausage was made.  Only how the sausage tastes.

Dude, leave that poor Unity strawman alone. Hasn't it suffered enough?

Maybe instead you can tell me more about supporting evidence for a silent update.

16 minutes ago, stibbons said:

Probably stop assuming Squad has anything to do with Steam maybe.

Squad determines what settings Steam applies for the game...

And yes, they changed it for whatever reason.

And oh, there is nothing in the Steam "update history" to show 1.1, 1.0.5, or any other update ever happened...

1 minute ago, jwenting said:

Squad determines what settings Steam applies for the game...

Citation needed.

And, yeah, no updates happened. I'm sorry the defaults changed, but at least you know where to open a support issue now.

23 minutes ago, klgraham1013 said:

How about we stop using Unity and Steam as excuses for Squad?  Consumers should not be expected to care about how the sausage was made.  Only how the sausage tastes.

Calm down, man. The window with the prompt is clearly a Steam window. It's the same sort of thing that DasValdez had to restart Steam for in the release party stream. That info comes from the steam package itself, and wouldn't require a build change.

One thing to check would be your Downloads page for the last time KSP was pushed to you. That would tell you if there was an actual update to game files in the time frame you're concerned about, or if it was only the Steam database entry.

Edited April 23, 2016 by pincushionman

Ummm, this is a Steam issue and is not from Squad

13 minutes ago, jwenting said:

Squad determines what settings Steam applies for the game...

And yes, they changed it for whatever reason.

Citation requested

Although I can tell you now you will find that Steam (Valve) determines what settings Steam applies to the game
I noticed the default switch to 32 bit as well, thought it was odd.
Must be a Windows thing. The OS X default remains 64-bit (build 1230).

3 hours ago, pincushionman said:

Calm down, man.

I was quiet calm when making that post.

1 hour ago, LameLefty said:

Must be a Windows thing. The OS X default remains 64-bit (build 1230).

that's because there is no 32 bit Mac version

1 hour ago, jwenting said:

that's because there is no 32 bit Mac version

Good, since that's the ONLY version of KSP available through 1.05, the last 32-bit version of OS X itself was 10.6 back in 2009, and the last system built by Apple with 32-bit only processors was in 2007 or so.

6 hours ago, SunburstMoon said:

Oh, and I had Steam check the integrity of the game cache: it reacquired 2 files but nothing has changed

You might wanna check your in-game settings, I bet those two files reverted them to default
